alert.note: Alert for Adams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 6:24PM EDT until May 06 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Northeast Kentucky and South Central Ohio, including the following counties, in Northeast Kentucky, Lewis. In South Central Ohio, Adams. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 623 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Although the heaviest rain has ended, additional rainfall over the next hour or two will worsen ongoing high water and flooding. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... West Union, Manchester, Rome, Blue Creek, Concord, State Route 348 at State Route 125, Carrs, Bentonville, Cedar Mills, Trinity, Bradysville and Sandy Springs.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
